dialogue: Patient: I've had a dull chest ache for two days
gold_soap: mostly when climbing stairs. No fever or cough. Doctor: Any nausea or sweating? Patient: Mild sweating yesterday. Doctor: Family history? Patient: Dad had a heart attack.
column3: Subjective: 2-day exertional chest discomfort with mild diaphoresis and positive cardiac family history. Objective: Vitals stable. Assessment: Suspected stable angina. Plan: ECG, troponins, lipid panel, limit exertion, follow-up.

dialogue: Patient: My lower back hurts since moving furniture last week. Doctor: Any tingling or bowel issues? Patient: No
gold_soap: just stiffness.
column3: Subjective: Acute low back pain after heavy lifting without red flags. Objective: Lumbar tenderness, normal neuro exam. Assessment: Mechanical lumbar strain. Plan: NSAIDs, heat, stretching, avoid lifting.

dialogue: Patient: I've been coughing with yellow mucus for 5 days. Doctor: Fever? Patient: Low fever yesterday.
gold_soap: Subjective: 5-day productive cough with low-grade fever. Objective: Mild rhonchi. Assessment: Acute bronchitis. Plan: Hydration, rest, symptomatic care.

dialogue: Patient: My periods have been heavier for 3 months. Doctor: Any dizziness? Patient: Sometimes.
gold_soap: Subjective: 3-month menorrhagia with intermittent lightheadedness. Objective: Pale conjunctiva. Assessment: Suspected iron-deficiency anemia. Plan: CBC, iron supplementation, discuss hormonal therapy.

dialogue: Patient: Sudden sharp pain in right ear after swimming. Doctor: Any discharge? Patient: No.
gold_soap: Subjective: Acute otalgia post-swimming without discharge. Objective: Erythematous external canal. Assessment: Otitis externa. Plan: Topical antibiotics, dry ear precautions.

dialogue: Patient: I've been unusually thirsty and peeing a lot for 2 weeks. Doctor: Family history? Patient: Mom has diabetes.
gold_soap: Subjective: Polyuria and polydipsia for 2 weeks with positive family history. Objective: Elevated random glucose. Assessment: Suspected type 2 diabetes. Plan: HbA1c, lifestyle counseling.

dialogue: Patient: My right knee clicks and hurts after running. Doctor: Swelling? Patient: Slight.
gold_soap: Subjective: Post-running knee pain and clicking with mild swelling. Objective: Tender lateral joint line. Assessment: Possible meniscal irritation. Plan: Rest, ice, NSAIDs, imaging if persistent.

dialogue: Patient: I haven’t slept well for a month. Mind keeps racing. Doctor: Caffeine? Patient: 3 coffees daily.
gold_soap: Subjective: 1-month insomnia with high caffeine intake. Objective: Fatigued but stable. Assessment: Sleep disturbance likely caffeine-related. Plan: Reduce caffeine, sleep hygiene.

dialogue: Patient: My throat burns after eating spicy food. Doctor: Any regurgitation? Patient: Yes.
gold_soap: Subjective: Post-meal heartburn and regurgitation. Objective: Normal exam. Assessment: GERD. Plan: PPI trial, avoid triggers.

dialogue: Patient: I’ve had itchy red patches on elbows for years. Doctor: Family history? Patient: Dad too.
gold_soap: Subjective: Chronic pruritic plaques with family history. Objective: Erythematous scaling plaques. Assessment: Psoriasis. Plan: Topical steroids, dermatology referral.

dialogue: Patient: Sudden nausea and vomiting since morning. Doctor: Abdominal pain? Patient: Mild cramps.
gold_soap: Subjective: Acute nausea/vomiting with mild cramping. Assessment: Likely viral gastroenteritis. Plan: Hydration, antiemetics.

dialogue: Patient: My vision gets blurry after long screen use. Doctor: Headaches? Patient: Yes.
gold_soap: Subjective: Screen-related blurry vision and headaches. Assessment: Eye strain. Plan: Screen breaks, eye exam.

dialogue: Patient: I've felt unusually sad for two months
gold_soap: low energy. Doctor: Any suicidal thoughts? Patient: No.
column3: Subjective: 2-month low mood and fatigue without suicidal ideation. Assessment: Mild depressive symptoms. Plan: PHQ-9, counseling referral.

dialogue: Patient: Sharp pain in left big toe
gold_soap: swollen since last night. Doctor: Alcohol intake? Patient: Weekend beers.
column3: Subjective: Acute painful swollen first MTP joint with recent alcohol. Assessment: Suspected gout. Plan: NSAIDs, uric acid level.

dialogue: Patient: I get dizzy when standing quickly. Doctor: Hydration? Patient: Barely drink water.
gold_soap: Subjective: Positional dizziness with poor hydration. Assessment: Likely dehydration-related orthostatic symptoms. Plan: Increase fluids.

dialogue: Patient: My child keeps pulling at her ear and crying. Doctor: Fever? Parent: Low fever.
gold_soap: Subjective: Ear pulling and irritability with low-grade fever. Assessment: Possible acute otitis media. Plan: Exam, analgesics, consider antibiotics.

dialogue: Patient: I’ve had burning when I pee for 3 days. Doctor: Any blood? Patient: Slight.
gold_soap: Subjective: 3-day dysuria with trace hematuria. Assessment: Suspected UTI. Plan: Urinalysis, oral antibiotics.

dialogue: Patient: I wheeze when running. Doctor: History of asthma? Patient: As a kid.
gold_soap: Subjective: Exercise-induced wheezing with remote asthma history. Assessment: Possible exercise-induced bronchoconstriction. Plan: Spirometry, rescue inhaler.

dialogue: Patient: Constant headache for a week. Doctor: Sleep? Patient: 4 hours a night.
gold_soap: Subjective: 1-week persistent headache with sleep deprivation. Assessment: Tension headache. Plan: Sleep hygiene, hydration, NSAIDs.

dialogue: Patient: Tingling in fingers when typing. Doctor: Wrist pain? Patient: Yes.
gold_soap: Subjective: Finger paresthesia associated with typing and wrist discomfort. Assessment: Suspected carpal tunnel syndrome. Plan: Wrist splint, ergonomic changes.

dialogue: Patient: Stomach cramps after drinking milk. Doctor: Happens often? Patient: Yes.
gold_soap: Subjective: Recurrent abdominal cramps after dairy intake. Assessment: Suspected lactose intolerance. Plan: Dietary modification, lactase trial.

dialogue: Patient: Shortness of breath climbing stairs. Doctor: Smoking history? Patient: 10 years.
gold_soap: Subjective: Dyspnea on exertion with smoking history. Assessment: Possible early COPD. Plan: PFTs, smoking cessation counseling.

dialogue: Patient: Nosebleeds twice this week. Doctor: Any trauma? Patient: No.
gold_soap: Subjective: Recurrent epistaxis without injury. Assessment: Likely mucosal dryness. Plan: Humidification, nasal saline.

dialogue: Patient: Painful urination and lower belly pressure. Doctor: Fever? Patient: No.
gold_soap: Subjective: Dysuria and suprapubic discomfort without fever. Assessment: Uncomplicated cystitis. Plan: Urinalysis, antibiotics.

dialogue: Patient: My joints feel stiff in the morning for an hour. Doctor: Family history? Patient: Mom has arthritis.
gold_soap: Subjective: Morning joint stiffness >1 hour with family history. Assessment: Possible rheumatoid arthritis. Plan: ESR, RF, rheumatology referral.

dialogue: Patient: I feel shaky and hungry if I skip meals. Doctor: Diabetes? Patient: No.
gold_soap: Subjective: Symptoms suggestive of hypoglycemia when fasting. Assessment: Possible reactive hypoglycemia. Plan: Dietary counseling, glucose monitoring.

dialogue: Patient: Constant heart fluttering. Doctor: Caffeine/energy drinks? Patient: Daily.
gold_soap: Subjective: Palpitations associated with stimulant intake. Assessment: Likely caffeine-related palpitations. Plan: Reduce caffeine, ECG.

dialogue: Patient: Sore throat for 2 days
gold_soap: painful swallowing. Doctor: Cough? Patient: No.
column3: Subjective: 2-day sore throat without cough. Assessment: Possible streptococcal pharyngitis. Plan: Rapid strep test, symptomatic care.

dialogue: Patient: I bruise easily. Doctor: Any medications? Patient: Blood thinner.
gold_soap: Subjective: Increased bruising with anticoagulant use. Assessment: Medication-related bruising. Plan: INR check, review dosing.

dialogue: Patient: Persistent bloating after meals. Doctor: Weight change? Patient: None.
gold_soap: Subjective: Postprandial bloating without weight loss. Assessment: Possible IBS. Plan: Dietary modification, symptom journal.
